text: Adela of Champagne (; c. 1140 – 4 June 1206; also known as Adelaide and Alix) was Queen of France as the third wife of Louis VII. She was the daughter of Theobald II, Count of Champagne, and Matilda of Carinthia. She was named after her grandmother, Adela of Normandy. Louis and Adela married on 18 October 1160. They had two children. Their son was Philip II. Philip was Louis's only son. Their daughter was the Byzantine empress Agnes.Gislebert of Mons' Chronicon When Adela's husband died in 1180, her son became king. In 1190, she acted as regent while Philip was away on the Third Crusade. Queen Adela died on 4 June 1206 in Paris, Île-de-France, France. She was buried in the church of Pontigny Abbey near Auxerre. ==Family tree== ==Sources== Category:1140s births Category:1206 deaths Category:Kings and Queens consort of France Category:Regents
